main event: A detailed UFO sighting report was filed regarding the observation of an object resembling a shooting star on May 6, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting involved an object that appeared extremely high overhead and disappeared and reappeared during the observation period., The observer noted similarities between the UFO and shooting stars seen prior to the sighting., The observation lasted for approximately one minute and 30 seconds with clear weather conditions., The object moved in a southeasterly direction, with its light fading gradually., The preliminary analysis suggested the sighting might be interpreted as a meteor despite the lack of confirmation regarding its characteristics.
sighted object: a shooting star type object resembling a bright star
witness description: Military personnel and a civilian observer affiliated with the U.S. Air Force
